connector.description: Send data to a Databricks Database. This Kamelet expects a JSON-formatted body. Use key:value pairs to map the JSON fields and parameters. For Unity Catalog workspaces, specify catalog and schema parameters.

camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.serverPort.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.serverPort
camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.serverPort.description: The server port for the Databricks data source.

camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.httpPath.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.httpPath
camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.httpPath.description: The HTTP path to the Databricks SQL Warehouse or cluster. Example: /sql/1.0/warehouses/abc123def456

camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.accessToke.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.accessToken
camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.accessToke.description: The personal access token to access Databricks.

camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.query
camel.kamelet.databricks-sink.query.description: The query to execute against the Databricks Database. Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)
